description: A simplified Trustline object used by the ripple-rest API
title: Trustline

___authorized_by_account.description: Set to true if the account has explicitly authorized the counterparty to hold currency it issues. This is only necessary if the account's settings include require_authorization_for_incoming_trustlines

___currency.description: The code of the currency in which this trustline denotes trust

___authorized_by_counterparty.description: Set to true if the counterparty has explicitly authorized the account to hold currency it issues. This is only necessary if the counterparty's settings include require_authorization_for_incoming_trustlines

___limit.description: The maximum value of the currency that the account may hold issued by the counterparty

___counterparty.description: The other party in this trustline

___account_allows_rippling.description: If true it indicates that the account allows pairwise rippling out through this trustline

___ledger.description: The string representation of the index number of the ledger containing this trustline or, in the case of historical queries, of the transaction that modified this Trustline

___account.description: The account from whose perspective this trustline is being viewed

___hash.description: If this object was returned by a historical query this value will be the hash of the transaction that modified this Trustline. The transaction hash is used throughout the Ripple Protocol to uniquely identify a particular transaction

___counterparty_allows_rippling.description: If true it indicates that the counterparty allows pairwise rippling out through this trustline

___previous.description: If the trustline was changed this will be a full Trustline object representing the previous values. If the previous object also had a previous object that will be removed to reduce data complexity. Trustline changes can be walked backwards by querying the API for previous.hash repeatedly

___reciprocated_limit.description: The maximum value of the currency that the counterparty may hold issued by the account
